reasoning: Atypical scrapie is a TSE (transmissible spongiform encephalopathy) primarily affecting sheep and goats. Human transmission is not established. Incidence in human population is effectively zero or unmappable, with extremely rare occupational exposure cases only.
source: EFSA (European Food Safety Authority). Scientific Opinion on the epidemiology of atypical scrapie in sheep and goats. EFSA J. 2014;12(2):3568
